As the winter already started and birds are having their migratory season, Cochin Natural History Society (CNHS) is organising the Kerala Bird Race 2017 at Kochi and outskirts on November 26 in its eleventh iteration. 

The Bird Race -though it has a competitive tone in it- is not a race yet encourages to push the limits to watch, listen, experience and record as many as birds during the course of a day. The participants can record their bird sightings on eBird Website using the eBird mobile App. After a hectic day of birding in the surrounding areas of Kochi city and outskirts- up to 50 km radius- the contestants will meet at a suitable place to share experiences of the day, cross-check and collate the sightings, determine which of the commonest birds missed; which of the rarest ones and who were the lucky to spot etc., with fellow travellers.

Birds always fascinate and intrigue us with their colours, shapes, songs, calls and their jizz which can move the hearts of even driest of the humans.We are in the midst  of the migratory birding season and now we can see many winged beauties in monochromes, duo tones and multicolour- vibgyor, both occurring throughout the year in our state and those who come to visit and enthrall us with the myriad hues and huge repertoire of songs  from other parts of the globe during this time of the year. 

The Bird Race with its fun element is the perfect reason and time to observe and enjoy the beauties in the company of our friends, family or expert birders.

Training Session

The event will also have a briefing session for new birdwatchers and experienced ones to interact with each other on the previous day of the race- at Mangalavanam Bird Sanctuary at 5 pm on Saturday, November 25.

eventname: Museum of Kerala History—Of Art, Artists and History
eventplace: Museum of Kerala History, Koonamthai, Edappally, Ernakulam
eventdetails:
India Heritage Walk Festival is a month-long festival led by Sahapedia and YES Culture. With its varied lineup, it explores the diversity that characterizes the cultural fabric of our country, such as, food, heritage, nature, art, architecture, and so on. There will be walks, talks, and films from across India covering a broad spectrum of Indian heritage and culture.

Visit: http://www.indiaheritagewalkfestival.com
Registration: http://www.indiaheritagewalkfestival.com/museum-kerala-history-art-artists-and-history

Kerala Museum in Edappally is one of Kochi's oldest museums. With works by modern masters such as Jamini Roy, Ramkinkar Baij, M.F. Husain, Ram Kumar, K.G. Subramanyan and Bhupen Khakhar, the museum's extraordinarily rich art collection is the only one of its kind in Kerala. This walk will introduce visitors to the story of the art collection and its founder, Madhavan Nayar, and explore key works in the collection.


Meeting Time: 10:15 AMThings to keep in mind:

Mandatory registration closes after 25 entries.

If you are unable to attend the walk after having registered, please inform us over an email or a text message.

Email us: ihwf@sahapedia.org

  • Carry an umbrella and enough drinking water.
  • Wear comfortable shoes.
  • Photography is permitted (no flash photography).
  • Kindly avoid littering during the walk.
  • Limited parking available.
Meeting Point: Ticket Counter, Museum of Kerala History
Nearest Bus/ Metro Station: Pathadipalam/KIMS
Walk Leader: Aditi Nayar
Medium: English
Partner:

5Km Run/Walk and 10Km Run (Open for all) – Rs. 999/-.

Special Event (3Km Run) for Kids and Parents. Run with your Lovely Parents to Support Girl Child and Give BETTER LIFE TO HER by run/walk in this charity run. 

Reporting time - 5:30 am

Zumba/Warmup - 6:00 am

Run Starts - 6:30 am

"Empowerment does not come with power. The first step to empowerment is to respect and recognize the value of education and what it brings to our society. And when we invest in a girl’s education, she feeds herself, her children, her community, and her nation. And we believe it is the righteous path towards the prosperity of our nation.

LET ME LIVE! LET ME READ!! is hosting a 10k Annual Start-up run to support the benevolent cause of Girl Education. They want to create awareness and help raise funds for the girl education and welfare of women in India.

It is not just a run but a step forward in a movement which is going to create affinities in what we want to achieve. We want aspiring entrepreneurs, exceptional founders, talented innovators and ambitious students in India to come together and run for a great cause and towards a more progressive India.

This run will not only help education but create limitless possibilities for numerous collaborations amongst people who share the same belief, who want to start something new and create an impact which is indefinable.

The previous year we helped 96 girls to get educated and this year we aim for 200. And it is not difficult for you by our side.

Special instructions:

* Runners will Get Water, Medical (First Aid) and Volunteers will be On The Route For Helping Runners.

* Baggage Counter & Car Parking Area is arranged inside event premises.

* We will have enough volunteers, banners, hydration zones to support our runners.

* Please do not litter the route. We will have dustbins all along the route.

* Plan to reach the venue at least 30 minutes before the start of the race as the R.U.N/Walk start on time.

* No refunds of registration amount or transfer of registration.

Narayana Bhattathiri is a name synonymous with Malayalam Calligraphy owing to his continuous creative endeavours to provide a visual aspect to Malayalam alphabets. He is the winner of the 2017 Jikji Award by the South Korean Government named after their first printed book "Jikji".

Vipanchika is the annual college fest of the School of Engineering, CUSAT, Kochi. Vipanchika blends a series of fine-arts, socio-cultural and literary events, along with a variety of exhibitions and informal events. Since its inception in 2002, Vipanchika never failed to amuse the viewers. The fest attracts thousands of visitors to the campus annually and is one of the biggest cultural fests in Kerala.

Viewers!!! Come prepared for Spot Games and win exciting prizes.

Our website http://riyaeducation.com/quiz

The workshop hopes to understand children and also explore how children learn naturally in a deeper manner. The school paradigm since it is the around question 'how to teach children’ has created lots of misunderstanding and misconceptions about cognition, creativity, and children. This has resulted in the creation of several methods of experiments upon children and teachers. Initiating research of how children make sense of the world naturally.

eventdetails:
Stories Worth Sharing Meetup is a unique concept of reviving human interaction via personal stories of people which may not have changed the world but changed (their) world.
They deserve an open platform to flourish and this is why we invite you to a meetup organized by a pan India initiative. 
We often find celebrated figures recognized for their stories but commoners like us are left unheard. Here is your chance to be heard yet again in Fort Kochi/Ernakulam!

#FUTURE would be the most high profile Digital Event and the best ever of its kind conducted in the state of Kerala. The two day event will see the convergence of achievers, professionals, entrepreneurs, academicians, key influencers and other stakeholders in the knowledge industry from across the globe. They will discuss though value adding sessions – key notes and panel discussions - emerging trends, ground realities and opportunities that would help individuals, enterprises and entrepreneurs to compete and lead in a digital world.

The theme of the event is ‘Towards a Digital Future’.

The purpose of #FUTURE is to inspire and energise people towards a knowledge-driven digital future. Such renewed energy, drive and aspiration should help facilitate the accelerated growth of the IT/ digital opportunities.

#FUTURE will be held on 2 days

Day 1: Thursday, 22nd March   Day 2: Friday, 23rd March

Main Speakers at the Event:

Nandan Nilekani, Infosys

Raghuram Rajan, Former RBI Governor

Byju Raveendran, BYJU'S

Gita Gopinath, Harvard University

R. Chandrashekhar, NASSCOM

For more details, 

Visit the website: http://towardsfuture.in/

Mamangam Dance School is organising ten days dance workshop for kids who have the passion to dance. The camp will concentrate on introducing contemporary dance and Kalari along with non-fire cooking, percussion, fun science, movie, crafts workshop, archery and fun.

It will be a complete entertainment for kids packed with fun. Learning becomes simple added with an element of fun to it and with this programme kids can also choose the art they love.

Summer Vacation Class

Age Groups: 5 to 15 years

Course Fee: 5000/-

Time schedule: 10:30 a.m to 3:00 p.m

Weather is a great metaphor for life and so is Monsoon for Happiness!!!
This time lets go for a camp has focused a frame of a great monsoon with pouring rains, lush green forests, tumbling and blushing waterfalls, and most importantly the drenched smiley faces!
Let's bring back the nostalgic moments we had gone through our monsoon days. Together let's get wet in rain, climb the hills, dip in pools as the rain falls on us, let's grin like a child and dance with it!
